new_filings.description: Amended Current Report, Item 5.02 (CEO transition documentation)
new_filings.significance: Formal SEC documentation of Warren Buffett to Greg Abel CEO transition

news_events.headline: Warren Buffett Left Wall Street 3 Deafening Warnings Before Retiring
news_events.summary: Analysis of Buffett's final moves: (1) Sold S&P 500 ETFs, (2) Net seller of $184B stocks, (3) $382B cash position. Interpretation: Buffett believes market unsustainable at current levels.

news_events.headline: What We Can Learn From Warren Buffett's Mistakes Going Forward
news_events.summary: Contrarian view: BRK.B has underperformed S&P 500 for 17 years (445.77% vs 554.84%). Argues value investing era is over, tech dominance is permanent.

news_events.headline: MISO Picks AEP, Berkshire's Joint Venture to build $1.2B 765-kV Line
news_events.summary: Berkshire Hathaway Energy Transmission wins $1.2B ultra-high voltage transmission project. Part of MISO's Long-Range Transmission Plan.

key_takeaways: BRK.B underperformance gap narrowing: -8.15pp (2025) → -1.14pp (W03 YTD). Three consecutive weeks of improvement.
Capital deployment pattern emerging: $10.9B deployed in 2 weeks (OxyChem $9.7B + BHE transmission $1.2B) into wholly-owned industrial/utility assets.
'Buffett's 3 warnings' narrative gaining traction: Media framing defensive positioning as prescient market timing.
S&P 500 at record 6,966 - extreme divergence between market euphoria and Berkshire's $372B cash caution.
Top holdings mixed: Consumer/energy strength (KO +3.78%, OXY +3.95%) vs. mega-cap tech/financials weakness (AAPL -2.95%, BAC -1.83%).
week_over_week_changes: BRK.B: +0.12% weekly, +0.45% YTD (vs. S&P 500 +1.59% YTD, gap -1.14pp)
Energy holdings continuing strength: OXY +3.95% (best performer among top 10)
Apple weakness continues: -2.95% weekly (worst performer among top 10)
Cash position reduced to ~$372B after $9.7B OxyChem deployment

positioning_assessment.market_valuation: EXTREME: S&P 500 at 6,966 (record high), 32% above first deployment trigger (4,720)
positioning_assessment.berkshire_stance: MAXIMUM CAUTION: $372B cash (30% of assets), 18 months without buybacks, net seller of $184B stocks over 2 years
positioning_assessment.deployment_watch: Abel deploying selectively into wholly-owned assets (OxyChem, BHE transmission), not overvalued public equities
positioning_assessment.inflection_signals: Underperformance gap narrowing, 'Buffett warnings' narrative gaining traction, capital deployment pattern emerging
